title: Japanese Chapter 9 Quiz: Daily Life Vocabulary & Polite Requests

questions.question: What does みずをください mean?
questions.explanation: みずをください (mizu wo kudasai) means "Please give me water" using the polite request form ください.

questions.question: What does コーヒーをいっつつ おねがいします mean?
questions.explanation: コーヒーをいっつつ おねがいします (koohii wo isshutsu onegai shimasu) means "Please give me coffee" using the polite request form.

questions.question: What is the polite way to make a request in Japanese?
questions.explanation: ください (kudasai) is the polite way to make requests in Japanese.

questions.question: What does おねがいします mean?
questions.explanation: おねがいします (onegai shimasu) is a polite way to say "please" when making requests.

questions.question: What does たべもの mean?
questions.explanation: たべもの (tabemono) means "food" in Japanese.

questions.question: Form the Japanese request "Please give me bread"
questions.explanation: This is a simple polite request using the pattern: Object + を + ください.

questions.question: What does のりもの mean?
questions.explanation: のりもの (norimono) means "transportation" or "vehicle" in Japanese.

questions.question: Form the Japanese request "Please give me tea"
questions.explanation: This is a more formal polite request using お願いします (onegai shimasu).

questions.question: What does にちじょう mean?
questions.explanation: にちじょう (nichijou) means "daily" or "everyday" in Japanese.
